void cubescript::bind ( T &  var,
const char *  name,
domain *  table 
) [inline]

A helper function for registering a symbol object to a domain.

Note:
Ownership of the symbol object is assumed by the specified domain.

std::string cubescript::compose_string ( const std::string &   ) 

Make string safe for use in CubeScript.

The function quotes (prepends a "\" character) to any characters that would cause a string construst parser to end prematurely.

std::string cubescript::exec_block ( const std::string &  input,
domain *  aDomain 
)

Execute a block of CubeScript code.

Parameters:
input a block of code (excluding the outer square brackets).
Returns:
eval result the string result of the last expression evaluation or the string argument passed to the last calling of the result function.

std::string cubescript::exec_file ( const std::string &  filename,
domain *  aDomain 
)

Execute a CubeScript file.

Returns:
eval result the result string of the last expression evaluation.
This helper function opens and passes a file input stream to exec_script.

std::string cubescript::exec_script ( std::istream &  input,
domain *  aDomain 
)

Execute a script of CubeScript code.

Returns:
eval result the result string of the last expression evaluation.
Expressions are parsed and evaluated until the input stream reaches EOF.

The difference between this function and exec_block is on error an exec_failure exception is thrown, containing the line number referencing the bad code and a pointer to the original raised exception.
